Key Match Events: Denver Nuggets used a third-quarter offensive surge to beat the Utah Jazz 129-103
Nikola Jokic scored 18 of his 27 points in the third quarter, helping the Nuggets outscore the Jazz 34-19
Utah committed 24 turnovers that the Nuggets turned into 39 points
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were dealing with injuries, with the Nuggets' Jamal Murray in concussion protocol and the Jazz missing Lauri Markkanen and Taylor Hendricks
Post-Match Reflections: The victory was in keeping with the Nuggets' home record against sub-.500 teams at home last season, when they were 15-0
The win was the Nuggets' first home win of the season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz have lost six consecutive games to start the season
The Nuggets host the Toronto Raptors on Monday night
Others: Russell Westbrook started in place of Jamal Murray
Cody Williams and Kyle Filipowski started for the Jazz due to injuries
